fields.value: Population of Counties, Towns, and Cities in the United States, 1850 and 1860

authorAffiliation.value: University of Chicago. Center for Population Economics

dsDescriptionValue.value: This data collection contains information about the population of each county, town, and city of the United States in 1850 and 1860. Specific variables include tabulations of white, black, and slave males and females, and aggregate population for each town. Foreign-born population, total population of each county, and centroid latitudes and longitudes of each county and state were also compiled.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR I.A.1.a. Census Enumerations: Historical and Contemporary Population Characteristics, United States, Decennial Censuses, 1790-1960 Censuses
NACDA I. Demographic Characteristics of Older Adults

value: POPULATION OF THE UNITED STATES IN 1860, WASHINGTON DC: Government Printing Office, 1864
All United States counties, towns, and cities in 1850 and 1860. The list was obtained from published data in POPULATION OF THE UNITED STATES IN 1860.
